abstract: Two days after Citigroup moved to untangled itself from Washington, the Treasury reversed course on plans to immediately sell a portion of its stake in the banking giant, according to a person briefed on the situation.
snippet: Two days after Citigroup moved to untangled itself from Washington, the Treasury reversed course on plans to immediately sell a portion of its stake in the banking giant, according to a person briefed on the situation.
lead_paragraph: Two days after Citigroup moved to untangled itself from Washington, the Treasury reversed course Wednesday and backed away from plans to immediately sell a portion of its stake in the banking giant, according to a person briefed on the situation.

headline.main: U.S. Said to Reconsider Sale of Citigroup Stake
